messages.ai_response: I can provide you with information and guidance on various legal aspects related to renting properties in England, such as the required documents for tenancies, council tax bands, right to rent checks, planning permissions for HMOs, and rent increase regulations. If you have any specific questions within these areas, feel free to ask!

source_documents.content:
Legal Information: Landlords must give tenants the latest “How to Rent: the checklist for renting in England” at the start of most assured shorthold tenancies (hard copy or PDF by agreement). Failing to do so can affect service of a valid no-fault notice under current law.

Tags: lettings, documents

Jurisdiction: England

Legal Information: Council Tax bands are set by the VOA. You can check a property’s band online and see how assessments work; band challenges follow VOA processes.

Tags: occupancy, council_tax

Jurisdiction: England

Legal Information: Landlords/agents in England must check a prospective tenant’s right to rent before the tenancy starts and keep records. Checks can be manual, via the Home Office online service, or by approved identity service providers, following the latest Home Office guidance.

Tags: lettings, checks, id

Jurisdiction: England

Legal Information: In Manchester, an Article 4 Direction removes permitted development rights for changing a dwellinghouse to a small HMO in many areas; planning permission is required to let to more than two unrelated people where Article 4 applies.

Tags: planning, HMO, article4

Jurisdiction: Manchester City Council

Legal Information: For periodic ASTs, landlords typically can raise rent no more than once a year using a Section 13 notice (Form 4). For fixed-term ASTs, increases must be agreed or provided for in the contract; otherwise apply after the term ends.

Tags: lettings, rent

Jurisdiction: England
